src:
Naslovne strane za četvrtak, 7. novembar 2019. godine

07 Nov 2019, 08:10

Dnevne novine na naslovnim stranicama izdanja za 7. novembar, pišu o okupljanju pristalica vlasti i opozicije ispred zgrade RTS-a tokom intervjua predsednika Srbije Aleksandra Vučića, o sudjenju bivšem predsedniku opštine Brus Milutinu Jeličiću Jutki za polno uznemiravanje i drugim temama.ALO  -  "Svedoci pakuju Kurtija za Hag", list piše o mogućnosti da lidera Samoopredeljenja Aljbina Kurtija pozove Specijalni sud za ratne zločine. "Čuvajte se lažnih siromaha na ulicama", list piše o prevarantima na beogradskim ulicama. BLIC  -  "Jutka doveo Šešelja da ga brani", o nastavku sudjenja Jeličiću zbog polnog uznemiravanja  Marije Lukić. "Možemo do čuda u Mančesteru" fudbaleri Partizana pred drugi meč u grupnoj fazi Lige evrope.VEČERNJE NOVOSTI  -  "Stop uvozu evro 3 i 4 polovnjaka?" o zagadjenju vazduha u Srbiji i novim propisima.DANAS  -  "Vlast je odgovorna što tenzije u društvu rastu", o okupljanju pristalica opozicije i vlasti ispred RTS-a tokom intervjua Aleksandra Vučića. "Žene Srbije podržale Mariju Lukić", o nastavku sudjenja Milutinu Jeličiću.INFORMER  -  "Djilas napao Boška: Kretenu opet smo ispali smešni", list piše o okupljanju opozicije ispred zgrade RTS-a uoči intervjua Aleksandra Vučića u Upitniku. "Daćemo Junajtedu bar jedan gol", izjava trenera Partizana Sava Miloševića uoči utakmice tog kluba i Mančester Junajteda. KURIR  -  "Bastać ojadio opštinu za 80 miliona", list navodi da je budžetska inspekcija utvrdila brojne nepravilnosti u poslovanju predsednika opštine Stari grad Marka Bastaća. "Videće Englezi jak Partizan", o predstojećoj utakimici Partizana i Mančester Junajteda. POLITIKA  -  "Nema razloga da SAD uvedu sankcije Srbiji", izjava ministra spoljnih poslova Ivice Dačića. "Presuda za 'švajcarce' poljuljala nedodirljivost banaka", intervju sudije Trgovačkog suda u Zagrebu Radovana Dobronića za Politiku.SRPSKI TELEGRAF  -  "Autom na Vučićevu kolonu", o dešavanjima ispred RTS-a. "Navijači Totenhema kao miševi u centru Beograda", list piše o atmosferi pred utakmicu izmedju Crvene Zvezde i Totenhema koja je odigrana u sredu uveče.
text:
Headlines for Thursday, November 7, 2019

07 Nov 2019, 08:10

The daily newspapers on the front pages of the November 7 issue, write about the gathering of supporters and opposition in front of the RTS building during an interview by Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic, the trial of former Bruce Mayor Milutin Jelicic Jutka for sexual harassment and other topics.AL - "Witnesses they are packing Kurti for The Hague, "the paper writes about the possibility of calling Self-Determination leader Albin Kurti to the Special Court for War Crimes. "Beware of the false poor on the streets," the newspaper writes of fraudsters on Belgrade's streets. BLIC - "Jutka brought Seselj to defend him", about continued trial of Jelicic for sexual harassment of Marija Lukic. "We can do miracle in Manchester" Partizan footballers before the second match in the group stage of the Europa League.VENCHER NEWS - "Stop importing Euro 3 and 4 halves?" on air pollution in Serbia and new regulations.Today - "The government is responsible for growing tensions in society", gathering supporters of the opposition and the authorities in front of the RTS during an interview with Aleksandar Vucic. "Women of Serbia Support Marija Lukic" on Continuing Trial of Milutin Jelicic.INFORMER - "Djilas attacked Bosko: We turned out to be ridiculous again," the newspaper writes about the opposition gathering in front of the RTS building ahead of an interview with Aleksandar Vucic in the Questionnaire. "We will give United at least one goal," Partizan coach Savo Milosevic said in the run-up to the club and Manchester United. KURIR - "Bastac ousted municipality by 80 million", the newspaper states that the budget inspection found numerous irregularities in the business of Marko Bastac, Mayor of Stari grad. "The English will see strong Partisans", about the upcoming Partizan and Manchester United outburst. POLITICS - "There is no reason for the US to impose sanctions on Serbia," statement by Foreign Minister Ivica Dacic. "Verdict for 'Swiss' Shakes Bank's Untouchability," Zagreb Commercial Court Judge Radovan Dobronić's Interview with Politika.SRPS TELEGRAPH - "Car on Vucic's Column", about events in front of RTS. "Tottenham fans are like mice in downtown Belgrade," the newspaper writes about the atmosphere ahead of the game between Red Star and Tottenham, played on Wednesday night.
